intro: Peckia guyanensis, commonly known as the Guyana peckia, is a flowering plant native to the rainforests of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. Its leaves are simple and ovate, with a smooth texture. Peckia guyanensis is often found growing in moist, shaded environments along riverbanks and in dense undergrowth.
